user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of has_unprocessed_upload_body_data_in_buffer:
```c
static bool
has_unprocessed_upload_body_data_in_buffer (struct MHD_Connection *c)
{
  mhd_assert (MHD_CONNECTION_BODY_RECEIVING == c->state);
  if (! c->rq.have_chunked_upload)
    return 0 != c->read_buffer_offset;

  /* Chunked upload */
  mhd_assert (0 != c->rq.remaining_upload_size); /* Must not be possible in MHD_CONNECTION_BODY_RECEIVING state */
  if (c->rq.current_chunk_offset == c->rq.current_chunk_size)
  {
    /* 0 == c->rq.current_chunk_size: Waiting the chunk size (chunk header).
       0 != c->rq.current_chunk_size: Waiting for chunk-closing CRLF. */
    return false;
  }
  return 0 != c->read_buffer_offset; /* Chunk payload data in the read buffer */
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
suspicious_frags: mhd_assert (0 != c->rq.remaining_upload_size); /* Must not be possible in MHD_CONNECTION_BODY_RECEIVING state */
explanation: Other fragments in the function are simple conditional returns that directly depend on runtime state (returns of the form "return 0 != c->read_buffer_offset;" and the non-chunked branch) and do not contain code placed after unconditional returns or statements that could syntactically never be reached. The comments are non-executable. The three selected fragments contain assertions and a conditional branch whose condition or asserted invariants are documented as "must not be possible" — these are the locations most likely to hide unreachable-code issues or violate the stated invariant assumptions and therefore warrant investigation. No other lines in the function present obvious unreachable-code patterns (e.g., code after an unconditional return, duplicated dead branches, or unreachable labels).
